intro: Kengyilia thoroldiana var. laxiuscula, commonly known as the slender kengyilia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing adaptations to harsh environmental conditions. Its foliage is generally narrow and grass-like, with the stems often remaining prostrate or ascending. The flowers bloom in late summer, producing a showy display that attracts various pollinators.
